title: How to write a letter to send my principal about a job - Quora

response.answer_text: Most schools have jobs posted online and on a bulletin board at the district office. There are established ways for people to apply for these jobs. Have you already followed this course of action? If so, a letter to the principal informing him/her that you have done so would be appropriate. But to attempt to go around the normal process might not send a good message. I suggest you apply first, then write the letter. You could include a cover letter and a resume that is tailored specifically for the job you are seeking. Sending a photo along with the letter would also be helpful. Hand delivering the resume and letter might give you the opportunity to meet the principal in person. But, as I said, sending a letter and resume without first applying is not a good idea in my view of the situation.

Please check for previous ‘how do I write a letter’ answers rather than simply posting such a question as if you were the only person in the world to have a problem performing a simple task. A letter is a letter. State your purpose, then close. How hard is that?
